passage_text: The (long-term) vision of Document Security is to ensure that information in documents can be protected by mechanisms that enforce a security and privacy policy, and that the mechanisms are not limited to a particular platform or even document processor. Split and merge into it. Expert answer by Peter Zavon. Confidence votes 52.5K. Document security is the process of ensuring the a document is correctly marked as to the level of security required for the information it contains, and that it receives that level of security.

View All | Close All. A Security Document is a document containing your confirmation code, name, and flight information, and it confirms that you are holding a reservation. A Security Document may be provided to assist you in passing through a TSA Security Checkpoint. An Enhanced Security Document is typically issued in place of a boarding pass when a reservation requires manual processing by an airport Employee, such as when you need to exchange your ticket, verify age, or fill out paperwork at the airport prior to receiving a boarding pass.
